A Todo task with the description you entered will be created. `event`, `deadline`, or `add`
can be used in place of `todo` to create different types of tasks.
Note that deadline and event type of tasks require you to add time argument after
While Saber supports multiple time format, to be safe, please follow either of the above format.
Saber will reply you acknowledging the creation of a Todo / Normal Tasks.
(This reply may vary depending on what type of task you create)
I'll add the following to your Todo list:
Your current tasks will be listed.
Saber will show you your task list.
Would you like to know what you
I'll list them for you, Master.
You can remove a task by entering `delete` followed by the task number.
Saber will remove the first task.
You can complete a task by entering `done` followed by the task number.
Saber will mark the first task as done.
I'll mark this done right away.
Sort your current tasks by complete-ness status.
Tasks that are not yet done will be on top, while tasks that are done will be listed after.
Saber will sort your current tasks.
Alright, I'll list them in done-ness
{list of tasks that are not done}
Find all tasks that contain the given word(s) in their description.
Note that the given word(s) is not case-sensitive.
Saber will find and list out all tasks that contain the given word(s) in their description.
Right away, Master. Please give me a
I'll list them for you, Master.
Saber will say bye and you will quit the program.

/** Encapsulates a parser for the Saber application (to parse user commands) */
* Constructs for the SaberParser class, this constructor will also parse the command
* @param unparsedCommand the raw unparsed command (from the user)
// To check whether the unparsed command has a time component to it and is a deadline or event command
// Because we do not want to unintentionally parse /at or /by as time when the command is not of type
// Only parse /at and /by as time when the command is of type deadline or event
* Gets Command Type of the command
* @throws SaberCommandNotFoundException if the command is not recognisable by Saber application
* @return the time parsed from the command as a String
* @throws MissingTimeException if the command does not have a time component
* @return the argument parsed from the command as a String
* @throws MissingArgumentException if the command does not have an argument component
* Gets a SaberCommand object from the command
* @return a SaberCommand object that the caller can use to execute the command
* @throws SaberCommandNotFoundException if the command is not recognisable by Saber application
command = new DeadlineCommand(deadlineTask, deadlineTime, false, false);
command = new EventCommand(eventTask, eventTime, false, false);

* A function to store all the tasks in the TaskList in the hard disk. This function will store the tasks
* @param taskList the TaskList containing all the tasks to be stored
* @param taskType an array of TaskType which corresponds to the task type of the tasks in the TaskList
* @throws SaberStorageStoreException if there is any IO, InvalidPath or Security exceptions

// This method will still be type safe as only tasks are stored in the file
public void store(TaskList taskList, Saber.TaskType[] taskType) throws SaberStorageStoreException {
// Suppress inspection for these methods because we want to ignore the result of these methods as in a

// path. As such, it is safe to suppress these warnings
// This will save the tasks into path/data/tasks.json
throw new SaberStorageStoreException("Fail to save tasks");
